intro: Aregelia indecora, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. Aregelia indecora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ease of care.
